subject: Philosophy
title: Dealing with Grief
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Dealing with Grief.

hook.text: Seneca lost his son. In his grief, he wrote letters that still comfort mourners today.

buildup.text: Stoics don't say 'don't grieve.' They say grief is natural â€” but endless grief serves no one.

discovery.text: The Stoic approach: honor the loss, remember the good, and gradually return to living well.

twist.text: Epictetus was blunter: you never really 'had' the person. You were given time with them, and time ended.

climax.text: That sounds harsh, but the point is gratitude for what was â€” not bitterness for what's gone.

punchline.text: Grieve honestly. Then live fully again.

quiz.question: How do Stoics approach grief?
options: Honor the loss but gradually return to living well
